hero.title: Young Women. Land. Dignity.
hero.subtitle: Empowering teen mothers through organic agriculture, financial inclusion, and secured market access.

about.governance_desc: Led by a dedicated Board of Directors and supported by expert advisors, ensuring transparency, impact, and sustainable growth.

advisors.title: Board Advisors
advisors.subtitle: Industry experts guiding our technical and scientific advancements.

effective.title: Effective Members
effective.subtitle: The operational engine driving daily impact.

bonnette.bio: Leading the strategic vision of AAYWA & PARTNERS to empower women through land ownership and market access.

nicole.bio: Innovation strategist and Women Empowerment Catalyst, campaigning for 'The United Alkebulan'. AfroFoods Direct Selling expert.

rose.bio: Orchestrating the operational excellence of our agri-tourism initiatives and stakeholder engagement.

solange.bio: Ensuring financial integrity and agronomic best practices for sustainable growth.

nadia.bio: Providing expert guidance on food processing standards and nutritional value enhancement.

ingabe.bio: Advising on product development and quality assurance for international markets.

colombe.bio: Pioneering sustainable farming models that serve as blueprints for our community cohorts.

benie.bio: Optimizing crop yields through regenerative techniques and hands-on farmer training.

hyacintha.bio: Specializing in soil health and organic pest management strategies.

shilla.bio: Driving organizational growth with a focus on Disability Inclusion and Women's Economic Empowerment.

concilie.bio: Managing the day-to-day logistics to ensure seamless farm-to-market operations.

faith.role: Modal Farm Owner | MK Farms Ltd.
faith.bio: Example of success: transforming MK Farms into a model of profitability and community impact.

hero.title: The AAYWA & PARTNERS Model
hero.subtitle: A scalable blueprint for regenerative, women-led agriculture that combines productivity, market access, and financial inclusion.

step1.title: Train & Equip
step1.desc: Young women join cohorts and receive training, compost, and seedlings (invoiced).

step2.title: Farm & Produce
step2.desc: Grow avocado/macadamia + vegetables using organic fertilizer on leased plots.

step3.title: Sell & Repay
step3.desc: Produce sold via Sanza or local markets; input costs deducted at point of sale.

step4.title: Share & Reinvest
step4.desc: Net profits split 50/50. Women earn income; Sanza reinvests in scaling.

innovations.title: Core Innovations
innovations.subtitle: Our model works because it addresses every aspect of the value chain.

profit_sharing.title: 50/50 Profit Sharing
profit_sharing.desc: A dignified partnership, not charity. Net profits are split equally between farmers and the enterprise.

organic_fertilizer.title: Organic Fertilizer Core
organic_fertilizer.desc: Compost is our central strategy‚Äîregenerating soil health while boosting crop yields sustainably.

vsla.title: VSLA Integration
vsla.desc: Financial inclusion built-in. Village Savings and Loan Associations empower saving and lending.

avocado.title: Avocado Focus
avocado.desc: High-value crop (Hass variety) intercropped for short-term food security and long-term profit.

warehouse.title: Warehouse Systems
warehouse.desc: Modern post-harvest management reduces losses and ensures premium quality for market.

champion.title: Champion Cascade
champion.desc: Peer-to-peer scaling where successful farmers train others, multiplying our impact.

map.subtitle: Select a location on the map to view detailed cohort performance data and crop distribution.
map.instruction: Clicking a dot reveals live data
map.quote: "This cohort has achieved 98% repayment in their first cycle."

cta.title: Scale This Model
cta.text: Partner with us to replicate AAYWA & PARTNERS nationwide. We have the blueprint, the team, and the proof of concept.

footer.description: Empowering young women farmers through regenerative agriculture in Rwanda.

story.quote: "We are not beneficiaries. We are farmers."
story.author: ‚Äî Marie, Cohort 1 Champion

social.afro_source_quote: AAYWA & PARTNERS proves that regenerative agriculture and women‚Äôs economic inclusion can go hand-in-hand. Their model ensures sustainability from the soil up.
social.sanza_quote: The 50/50 model builds real trust. We are not just giving supplies; we are building a business together with these farmers.

hero.subtitle: Support Rwanda's young women farmers and experience premium organic produce directly from the source.

product_details.description: Grown with care by our partner farmers in Musanze. Detailed quality assurance checks performed before shipment. Fresh from the farm to your doorstep.
